publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1624 Tommy Sheridan: National Health Serviceâ€”That the Parliament notes the increasing concern expressed by parents and many in the medical profession across Scotland regarding the triple MMR vaccination for measles, mumps and rubella and agrees, in the interest of addressing this serious public concern and in order to maximise choice for worried parents in relation to these important vaccinations, to allow immediately single vaccinations across the National Health Service in Scotland for at least a five year period, during which a detailed study of autistic spectrum disorder should take place and its incidence throughout Scotland should be closely monitored.
S1M-1624 National Health Service (lodged on 2 February 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
